fields.description:
Currently the default project is anchored to the first project ID and can't be deleted (it can be edited) However it'd be better to mark a project as the default project and not anchor the default project to ID 1.

You should be able to delete any project so long as there is one left.

The need for any kind of default project should be examined: When creating a review, if the project-to-use is not specified then the user is prompted for the project-to-use anyway.

fields.description:
I have a review with a patch uploaded to it. The files in it have a number of comments on them in Crucible. If I go to manage the patch revisions for it, and un-check the patch, I get the attached error.

I'm guessing this is a valid error, but I'd expect it to be a little more user friendly.

fields.description:
In large organizations, it is possible that certain LDAP ID's exists that should not be added into Crucible through the LDAP sync method.

- Give an option to ignore certain strings
-- Example:  prodid*, machgen*
fields.summary: Give ability to ignore certain users in LDAP

fields.description:
- Crucible and Fisheye config.xml is not backwards compatible.

- Add a version line to the config.xml that shows ether:
-- Version this config file will run with 
-- Version this config file is compatible with

When running multiple Crucible installs that may be on different versions due to upgrade plans, it is very easy to startup an older install on a new config file.

- Error log should be able to warn that the config file is not compatible and give reasonable explanation why.
fields.summary: Add Version Compatiblity Line to Config.xml file
Add web item rendering Phase 2

Create User Profile Tab Decorator
Create atl.admin decorator
Create atl.general decorator

fields.description:
When uploading a patch file in Crucible, if the patch file has been generated to show a lot of the file (ie in Subversion, doing a diff with up to 10000 lines such as "svn diff <dir> \--diff-cmd diff \-x "-U 10000" > patch.txt", but same idea for whatever SCM you use, I'm sure you get the idea), then it is a bit of an annoyance to have to scroll down quite a ways in the file if the first difference is far down.  Instead, it would be desirable to have buttons somewhere on the page that say something like "Next Diff" or "Prev Diff" or "<<" or ">>" and when you click on these, it takes you to the first diff immediately and then continues to take you to the next one if you hit next, etc.    Otherwise, it's frustrating to scroll through a large file with few differences to check them all when using patch files.  And it is beneficial to generate large patch files (ie. -U 10000) because sometimes designers want to see the whole file (or most of it) and with patch file you don't have that option unless you do something like -U 10000 (unlike if they did the inspection directly on stream where they could just click "Show Diff options" and click "Full").
Thanks.
fields.summary: Ability to move to first difference in a patch file diff....

fields.description:
Context lines can be duplicated with Patch diff options.
Discovered while Unit testing and then reported by a customer (see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-448).
In some cases context lines can overlap causing a repeated line.
The number of Context lines displayed is incorrect too, one more line is displayed than requested.
fields.summary: Context lines can be duplicated with Patch diff options

fields.description:
Adding a Confluence page to a review does not allow you to diff it to a specific revision (or for any light svn plugin). The value for "Diff To" is ignored and the page is diffed against the previous revision.
"Whole File"  does work and so does "Diff to last reviewed revision".

Also, the change-diff dropdown does not appear for the author of the review.
fields.summary: "Diff To" is ignored in "Add Files" in Lite SCM
Review Entire Projects

fields.description:
It's confusing when choosing a format of review.

The exact steps you need to get it to work (when using Fisheye):
# Go to _Create New Review_ in Crucible
# Under the _Manage Files_, select a fisheye repository and an _Add to Review as_ type
# You need to select the drop down first before selecting the file otherwise it won't work
# E.g do a "diff to" between revision ID 29 and 42 like [this|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/31033/diff.png]. I would expect the result like [this|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/31032/working.png]. However, if you select the file before selecting the drop down list, Crucible will show the latest review like [this|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/31031/notworking.png]
# See the results in the "Review" tab
fields.summary: Choosing the format of review is too confusing

fields.description:
example:
{code}
Brendan Humphreys Replied
re: revision External DB Spec (lines 79)(see https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-861#c7160 ) :-

h3. Setup new instance to point to custom db

* User runs Crucible for the first time, they are presented with the existing setup screen
* They are asked if they want to use an external db
* They are presented with the setup jdbc wizard (as above)
**  They can choose a dialect. This selects a default driver class.
*** One dialect is "built-in" in which all the other fields are hidden.
** They enter in jdbc url, username/password and optional properties.
** They can hit "test connection" which reports on the ability to connect to the db.
** They hit "Next > create scheme" which creates the schema
** Any errors and they are shown and they bounced to the enter-jdbc screen to try again

In reponse to thread:
(Brendan Humphreys) none of these usecases invoke GUI admin screens. I think they all should.

h3. Migrate to a new database type.

* Go to admin, go to Migrate to Other DB section
* User is prompted with "setup jdbc" wizard/screen (see below)
* User enters jdbc details, can test the connection.
* User clicks Next-Perform Migration which
** puts app into export mode
** exports jdbc and plugins (see inport/export doc)
** swaps the connection manager to the new jdbc location.
** runs an import of what was just exported
** Displays progress of the above on-screen
* saves changes to config.xml (ie jdbc change is not persisted until re-import works)

> > (Peter McNeil) I think that is a stretch goal for database, perhaps after we have import/export which will no doubt be after external DBs are enabled (with no data migration).

I'm not saying that it's not doable by 2.0 but for this spec and the inital release.... So are we specing out

{code}

My incompleted draft comment has been included when Brendan edited his comment in this case
fields.summary: Draft comments (auto saved) are included in comment notifications

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce. 

1) Add some files in your repository with the following names:

file--blah.txt
file2--blah.txt
file3--blah.txt
filbl--ah.txt

2) Create a review and add these files to the review 

The files will all be rendered on one line rather than line by line. 

This is because we create comments as below:

{noformat}
<!-- Repo Link to  revision svn://URL/file--blah.txt@438 -->
{noformat}

I.e. the comment contains "--" and this is not [handled|http://lists.evolt.org/archive/Week-of-Mon-20061030/185946.html] by firefox.
fields.summary: file names with "--" in their name will not be rendered properly in crucible reviews

fields.description:
If a reviewer has marked File Revisions as complete and you try to remove and re-add that reviewer (to force uncomplete on that reviewer) you get a constraint violation:-

 [java] Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Integrity constraint violation FKC51038F8BBB0C6CE table: COMPLETED_FRX in statement [delete from REVIEW_PARTICIPANT where PARTICIPANT_ID=?]

Workaround is to contact reviewer directly.

Fix, unset completed Frx references to that reviewer before removing the participant.

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-445
fields.summary: Removing a reviewer who has marked FRX's complete cause JDBC update exception

fields.description:
Auto save seems to have a number of issues:-

* if you highlight and copy a section of a comment and try and paste it in FF2 (linux) the copy and paste is messed up (it copies too much/too little and can paste in the wrong place)
* the cursor disappears on first save (and can move around the comment in an unexpected way)
* we have draft comments appearing in reply email notifications
* draft comments that are discarded not being deleted
* the save button is almost always disabled when you go to click it due to timing of auto save from last change, it tends to conincide with the time you take to finish a comment then want to hit save.

I have left the title here general so we can create sub issues.

It would be nice to be able to disable autosave if you don't want it.
fields.summary: Autosave has issues

Is this a bug or am I doing something wrong on my end?

In my opinion, the line-missing markers should always be there. They are super useful. Attached shot1 shows them and shot2 is missing.

fields.description:
Crucible improperly processes patch files for diffs on files with leading dashes in their lines. This is really easy to reproduce with Lua files.

I attached a rev-1 and rev-2 version of a demo Lua file. I also made a diff using "diff -Nar --unified=100 file-rev1.lua file-rev2.lua >lua-patch.txt" and attached that file as well.

If you create a review in Crucible and upload lua-patch.txt you'll get a diff that stops at line 57 of the patch file. After that line of ------'s the remainder of the file that was added in rev 2 is invisible to Crucible.

My guess is that it's a bug in processing of the --- leader to separate files in patches. If I prefix all the comments in the file with a space before the -- then Crucible processes the patch properly. I'm uploading lua-patch2.txt which shows this to be the case.
fields.summary: Improper handling of uploaded patch files with lines that have leading dashes

fields.description: for file uploads, Patch & File, we have a hard coded limit of 10MB. It would be good if that limit could be configured.
fields.summary: Provide configuration for file upload limits

fields.description:
All users have created author mappings between their Crucible account and their Perforce account for each depot.  However, when creating a new review, it doesn't usually work, it picks me as the author.  We need author mappings because Crucible is using the LDAP account which for legacy reasons does not match the login account for most people.

I have a few comments here, which are perhaps separate issues, but since it is all related I'll just list them:

1. It would be nice if we didn't even need to create an author mapping at all; although the Perforce account names don't match the Crucible login names, the e-mail addresses do match, and could be used as a fallback matching point.  Most source control systems have an e-mail field.

2. This could be another case sensitivity issue; when selecting an author mapping the names are listed lowercase in the dropdown, but the Perforce account names are not lowercase, most of them are mixed case, for example "John_Smith".  (The reason for this scheme is because Perforce doesn't really make any use of the readable name, so we found using our Windows login names to be impractical.)

3. I take it on faith that all other users set up the author mappings correctly; I can't easily check all of them because even as an administrator, I can't edit other users.  As an administrator, I should be able to set this up for everyone, sounds like a missing feature.

From what I see, the only accounts where the review selects the author correctly are the ones where the Perforce name matches the Crucible name.  To me, this appears that the author mapping just doesn't work at all.  It is hard for me to debug this, because I am one of the people who works correctly (my P4 and LDAP logins are the same).
fields.summary: Author Mapping doesn't always work

fields.description: Quickie: looks like the "generalCommentData" type has a spelling error. It's using "permId" instead of "permaId" like every other data type uses.
fields.summary: Apparent spelling error in REST XML returned in review details

FishEye was unable to process your request.

You are running release CR1.6.2 FE1.6.2 (build-333 2008-10-21), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

fields.description: Users can currently set their notification scheme to email them whenever a comment is made. A customer has asked for the option to be emailed only when a reply is made to a comment thread they have contributed to.
fields.summary: Enable notifications of comment replies only

fields.description:
Currently, an email notification is sent out immediately to each recipient for each review action on their notification scheme. As an example, when a 10 review comments are added within half an hour, the current system sends 10 email notifications. 

Some customers would like to reduce the amount of email sent from Crucible, by adding an email queue and timer-based email job, so that the system waits for a number of minutes and then sends a batch update. The new system under 30-minute timer would send a single email with 10 updates, or a 10-minute timer in between 2 and 3 emails. 

Whenever a notification is added to the email queue and the email queue is empty, the email job is set to run in X minutes from now. Any subsequent notifications are added to the queue. The email job empties the queue by sending a single batch email to each recipient with all their notifications.
fields.summary: Support bulk/batch email notifications

fields.description:
There're some new features that go live with 1.6.4 (CRUC-398: file uploads through REST) that come with documentation on CAC. I've already made the additions in as a hidden draft, so that can be published as is.

It's this page:
[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/(hidden+draft+1.6.4)+Review+Service+-+Reviews]
fields.summary: Publish new CAC pages on 1.6.4 release

fields.description: Extend the ReviewItemData description to include the new links.
fields.summary: Describe this in the CAC docs.

fields.description:
Since upgrading to 1.6.3, we can no longer update versions of a file under review if it has a comment against it.
Our workflow involves creating a crucible at the start of a task (not the end) and continuous review / feedback throughout the task.
Thus developers update their crucible reviews with latest revisions of files after each checkin.
We cant expect them to create and link a review per checkin (at least once a day per task).

To reproduce:

- Create a new crucible review and add some files.
- Add a comment to one of the files
- Check in a change which modifies the file you added the comment to
- Attempt to update the crucible review with the new version of the file (It wont let you - complaining with "XXX cannot be added because it has comments"

Looks possibly related to: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-694
fields.summary: Cant update versions of new files with comments

fields.description:
REST should be able to provide access to the contents of the items/files under review.
To this end we should have a resource in REST that represents the contents of an item, possibly with additional query parameters that select certain line sections to be returned, instead of the entire file.
For revision items, maybe we should provide the diff in patch-file format?
fields.summary: Retrieve file contents through REST

fields.description:
When I view a review, all of the files that are part of the review appear in seemingly random order.

This makes it very difficult to review related files one after another - especially when there are dozens of files in the changset under review.

Could the files please be at minimum, sorted by file path / name?   Then at least files in the same directory will show up next to each other in the listing.
fields.summary: Listed files in changesets under review should be sorted
Add Web Fragment Plugin Points

fields.description:
At present SCMSource is missing the getChnageSet, isAfter and isBefore, which are needed by ReviewCreationHelper, so ReviewService.createReviewFromChangeSets doesn't work.

Using createReview() and then addFisheyeDiff() should work for LightSCM repos, but needs a test.

We should rename addFisheyeDiff() to addRevisionsToReview() 

Talk to Tom.  Review creation using the same API as for fisheye repos.
fields.summary: Allow creation of reviews on LightSCM repos from ReviewService, and hence REST

fields.description:
From RestReviewService.addFile():

        /*
         * Note: I'm using Apache common fileupload here to parse the multipart
         * request and extract the uploaded files. However, it's also possible
         * to let Jersey parse it and inject the uploaded files using:
         *
         * addFile(@FormParam("file")File file, @FormParam("diff")File diff, ..)
         *
         * Unfortunately the JAX-RS API does not contain methods to retrieve
         * the file's original filename. Jersey fixes this as of 1.0.1-SNAPSHOT
         * (released just last night) which contains a FormDataContentDisposition
         * class that contains the meta data of form items:
         *      http://blogs.sun.com/sandoz/entry/formparam#comment-1220438732000
         *
         * I chose common fileupload because Jersey's solution is vendor-specific
         * and only a few hours old.
         */

From review CR-FE-786:

eric, maybe raise a jira to upgrade to latest jersy, and change the implementation here as per your note
Erik van Zijst [ 16 November 2008, 17:57 ] 	
We are on the latest stable Jersey (1.0). I wouldn't just upgrade to the latest trunk snapshot if there's nothing broken or missing in the stable branch. I'd prefer to stick with Apache Common Fileupload until Jersey has the same functionality (1.0.1-SNAPSHOT does not enforce max file size) in a stable branch, or when when we are forced to move to a snapshot because the stable branch doesn't work for us. Agree?
Matt Quail [ 16 November 2008, 18:02 ] 	
definitely agree: raise a jira to upgrade to a stable 1.0.1, and modify this method then (or when it does support max-file-size)
fields.summary: Upgrade Jersey when its stable branch offers proper file upload
P4 Lite SCM plugin does not repect paths when listing changesets

fields.description:
Please add review coverage so that organisations who require reviews for all code can confirm that each file has been reviewed at least once, and that all their commits past a certain date have had a review. 

Currently, it is possible to pull a list of revisions that haven't been reviewed using EyeQL.
fields.summary: List all files that have never been reviewed and all unreviewed commits after a certain date

fields.description:
see FSH-1301

The problem is caused by a change in the isBinary test that uses the isBinary flag set on a revision, but guesses the type from the filename if not present. The details of the revision should always be updated if a fisheye repository, however the lack of a binary flag is not checked and the details version has not been updated between 1.6.2 and 1.6.3 so it's never updated.

It only affects reviews made in 1.6.2 where the file type is unknown.

Workaround is to add extensions to FISHEYE_HOME/raw-mime.types
fields.summary: Reviews created in 1.6.2 with revisions of unknown content type (text) show as binary in 1.6.3 and never updated

fields.description: Previously, in 1.6.2.1, the user's comments had been slightly different to aid in differentiating between the comment's author.  Now that we have upgraded to 1.6.3, all comments have the same color background.  The differing background provided better usability.  Was this feature intentionally left out of this version (1.6.3) or is this something that we now must configure?
fields.summary: Different background color for user comments

fields.description: Right now there is only a global admin role.  It would be nice to allow users to be assigned to a repository (project?) level admin role that grants the assigned users admin access to the specified repository configuration settings.  This would be separate from the global admin role and help in managing the repository configurations.  Thanks,
fields.summary: Repository level admin roles

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a review for a revision prior to HEAD of a file.
# Comment on that revision
# Delete the comment
# On the _Managed Files_ try to add a newer revision of the same file to the review
fields.summary: Can't add new revision of a file already under review if commented on - even if comment is deleted

fields.description:
According to studies, the effect of code peer review is a factor of the time spent reading the code, the number of lines in the review. For example, some studies say reviews should not comprise more that 200 lines of code.
If the results of these studies are consistent, it would be nice if Crucible took those (configurable) criteria and displayed things like "your review contains more than x lines of code which may reduce its effectiveness" or "Crucible recommends you spend x minutes on this review".
fields.summary: Compute and display metrics on the "review-weight"

fields.description: Would be nice to have wiki markup in comments, similar to what is possible in JIRA comments.
fields.summary: Markup in Crucible Comments

fields.description: Users are having trouble using the REST API due to unclear and incomplete documentation. Especially problematic is that the docs do not clearly state which fields are required and which are optional when sending a request.
fields.summary: Specify which elements are mandatory in REST API calls

fields.description:
Upgrade to hsql 1.8.0.10

Please include the src.jar in the mvn deployment.

Changelog is:

2008.06.02  1.8.0.10

Fixed deadlock in shutdown of Server
Fixed bug that in some circumstances could result in corrupted .data file and
cause Null Pointer or other exceptions.
New database property hsqldb.lock_file, true by default. When false, no lock
file is created when the database is opened.
Compile with JDK 6 is possible
New implementation of lock file
Fixed issue with org.hsqldb.Servlet
Fixed issue with scripting of views
Fixed issue with HsqlTimer
Minor improvement to WebServer
Minor corrections to utilities
Correction to build.xml to allow hsqldbmin target
fields.summary: upgrade to hsql 1.8.0.10

fields.summary: error when sending review to moderator

fields.description: the button is already in the usual spot. and being next to the Save and Cancel (details) doesnt fit with Abandon (entire review)
fields.summary: remove abandon button from edit details section

fields.description:
When upgrading from 1.6.1 to 1.6.2+ we make a backup of our crudb before proceeding with the upgrade. 

We should always make a backup of the crudb (if we don't already) before doing an upgrade and we should also backup other configuration files (data dir, config.xml) so that customers can easily roll back should they forget to make a backup before upgrading.
fields.summary: If we haven't already we should automatically create a backup of our CRUDB (and other configuration files) before upgrading

fields.description: Add the abilityt o expand only the files which are not checked-off. This would allow a reviewer to resume a review and only consider those files which have not already been checked off.
fields.summary: Add an Expand Unchecked Files option

fields.description:
For file upload reviews it would be nice to add context information like paths and revision numbers.

This might be better placed for a lite SCM plugin however?
fields.summary: Add path/context information to file uploads

fields.description:
as it is not a 'summary'. 

also, move review details in the ftl file to the top
fields.summary: change all references of 'summary' to 'all comments'

fields.description: Create JSR-170 (JackRabbit) SCM Plugin as Code Example
fields.summary: Create JSR-170 (JackRabbit) SCM Plugin as Code Example

fields.description:
From a customer: 

it would be great if Crucible recognized that the same file was checked in multiple times for the same issue and automatically provides a diff between the "pre-issue" version of the file and the "last version checked in for this issue" version of the file.
fields.summary: ability to provide pre-issue revision and latest issue revision diff

fields.description:
The Complete button is next to the Email Review button and has the same style, but a very different action. Where many buttons with that style - Return to Review, Dashboard - are navigational, the Complete fires the process off. It would be more consistent if the process didn't  fire until there was a user initiated action on the receipt page.

In addition the current receipt page message is confusing.  

When completing a review, the system message comes back:
"You have marked CR-FE-746 as completed."

This would be more instructive as: 
"You have marked your review of CR-FE-746 as completed."

If users have to learn that some messages have to be interpreted, they place less importance on the messages.
fields.summary: Confusing action and  message when completing review

fields.description: Verify with Tom. We are talking about events that are passed to listening plugins as distinct from activity stream events
fields.summary: Add Actioning User to Crucible/Fisheye events

fields.description: Useful as demonstrational stuff during/after AtlasCamp.
fields.summary: Create JackRabbit Example LightSCM Plugin

fields.description:
Currently you can fetch from Crucible only all users regardless whether they are allowed as reviewers in given project or not.
This makes adding reviewers to review quite hazardous (and possible now only due to bug CRUC-814).

We need this feature to fix Connector "join review" and "Set reviewers" functionalities: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-813
fields.summary: REST API should allow retrieving allowed reviewers for given project

fields.description:
Even if you configure Crucible to say allow only user A and B as reviewers, still it's possible to add via API user C.
Such illegal reviewer is visible in main review page, but is not displayed when you want to edit your review.
fields.summary: REST API does not respect allowed reviewers for the project.

fields.description:
Many members of my development community are complaining about the usability of side-by-side diff mode.
When this mode is used the two views of source (before and after) are very wide.
You can only scroll the entire browser window.
It would be nice to have scroll bars on each side of diff.
This is how we do it with non-web gui like TortoiseSVN  and Subclipse plugin.
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff mode is too wide

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) Create project with key par
2) Create a review for changeset in project par (lets call it par-1)
3) Delete project par and move the existing reviews to default project
4) Navigate to the your crucible dashboard
5) If you try to go into the review that used to belong to par-1 the page redirects back to the crucible dashboard, because the link it redirects to is [http://sol:localhost/cru/] (see screenshot) 
6) If you directly go to the review via the old link ([http://localhost:8060/cru/par-1]) the page constantly redirects to itself. 
7) You cannot access the review in another way for example via CR-1 despite the fact that it should have been moved to the default project.
fields.summary: Delete projects and move existing reviews to default project renders those reviews unreachable via the UI

fields.description: In the Upload tab of the File Manage area, disable the Upload button till a file is selected for upload
fields.summary: Disable upload button till file selected

fields.description:
works OK in 1.6.3 sows an error in place of the file.

An error occured attempting to display this file.

java.lang.Exception: Not enough revisions to diff
fields.summary: File upload of a single text file gives ava.lang.Exception: Not enough revisions to diff

fields.description: the ajaxy thing for selecting the text encoding of an upload file is not obvious enough, people will upload using ascii then ask support how they can set it to utf-8
fields.summary: selecting text encoding for file uploads is not obvious

fields.description:
The SCMModule interface declares a getter and setter for ModuleDescriptor. The descriptor contains information about the plugin used by the atlassian common plugin framework, but it's questionable whether it is of any value to scm plugin developers. On top of that, the DefaultRepositoryService.createRepositoryData() method currently relies on plugin implementations to return the ModuleDescriptor instance that was passed to it.

It may be better to inject the com.atlassian.plugin.PluginAccessor into the DefaultRepositoryService class and use that to get to the plugin's CompleteKey and at the same time deprecate/remove [gs]etModuleDescriptor() from SCMModule.
fields.summary: Remove [gs]etModuleDescriptor() from SCMModule interface

fields.description: http://img.skitch.com/20081103-tpte3md3fy7jtrc2r22piw5wmb.jpg
fields.summary: links to FE from a non-FE repository in crucible are broken
Revisit changes to Search tab contents in Manage Files area

fields.description:
Peter reported that "This test doesn't work when there is a constraint - i.e. the default. "

Relating to this code: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-739#c6054
fields.summary: Test cases are failing in control navigation

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to turn off captcha for registration.  In an internal corporation context trust is implicit that the person registering is a real person.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of captcha for signup and password recovery

fields.description:
When the Upload form from the Manage Files area is submitted, the path info is not passed through and results in the UI dropping from five tabs to three.

Prior to submit, the URL might end like this:
/edit-upload/~author=nick/edgylicensing
With these tabs:
Changesets | Files | Search | Patch | Upload

Post the submit, its been reduced to:
/edit-upload
With only these tabs:
Patch | Upload
fields.summary: File Upload from the Manage Files area drops the path info on submit

fields.description: It looks like Crucible does not remember that the comment is added using the Full diff context, and therefore the comment appears in the wrong place next time the review is viewed. The user has to remember to switch the diff context.
fields.summary: If a comment during the review is added using Full diff context when looking at the review next time the comment is shown on wrong line

fields.description:
H2 seems to have better performance than HSQLDB...  might make a better memory database:

http://www.h2database.com/html/main.html
fields.summary: Support for h2 vs hsqldb

fields.description:
One of our developers is Irish, and as such his surname has a single quote in it

Someone.O'Reilly@example.com

This address works in most programs, but Crucible doesn't allow this quote character,
which means one of our developers will not get any updates from Crucible.

The userEdit page comes back with "Not a valid email address"
fields.summary: Allow single quote in a user email address

fields.description:
The FishEye repos are only visible (i.e. returned by getRepositories()) when the current principal has access to it. However, the repositories provided through plugin (light) scm modules are always returned, even to anonymous users.

The SCMRepository interface has an isAvailable(Principal) method that is poorly documented. We currently just include the return value in the RepositoryData instance that is returned through the API, but it's not used for access control. What's the intended use for this method? Is it to allow plugin writers to restrictively allow access to repos? If so, we should enforce it in the api and document it as such. If not (after all, shouldn't access control be handed by Crucible itself?), then why pass the Principal to isAvailable()?
fields.summary: Visibility of Crucible SCM Plugin Repositories

fields.description:
When I ask Crucible to add new comment it returns that comment but without author _display name_ filled.
I would like Crucible to fill _display name_ field according to the _user name_

URL:
myhost/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-43/comments
Request:
{code}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<generalCommentData>
  <createDate>2008-10-29T13:32:37.932+01:00</createDate>
  <user>
    <userName>user</userName>
  </user>
  <defectRaised>false</defectRaised>
  <defectApproved>false</defectApproved>
  <deleted>false</deleted>
  <draft>false</draft>
  <message>fffffffff</message>
  <metrics />
  <replies />
</generalCommentData>
{code}

{code}
Response:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<generalCommentData>
  <createDate>2008-10-29T13:32:37.932+0100</createDate>
  <defectApproved>false</defectApproved>
  <defectRaised>false</defectRaised>
  <deleted>false</deleted>
  <draft>false</draft>
  <message>fffffffff</message>
  <metrics />
  <permaIdAsString>CMT:617</permaIdAsString>
  <user>
    <userName>user</userName>
  </user>
  <permId>
    <id>CMT:617</id>
  </permId>
</generalCommentData>
{code}
fields.summary: I need user DISPLAY NAME in Crucible response

fields.description: That is, when you are looking at individual modules, you don't see the enable/disable link for the plugin as a whole
fields.summary: plugin admin page hides Enable link when plugin is expanded
